result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kollin Robert Christenson

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Kollin Robert Christenson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant of right to counsel. Defendant advised has been trying to get in touch with SPD office, will be going to Black River to contact them.  AIA set. Bond cont.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant not to enter bars or taverns, or any place where alcohol is sold or served for on-premises consumption.
